author: Phantom
title: A very nice little Police boat-great for city!
review:
Im more of a star wars fan, but this boat-for me, is excellent, sure, its only got around 20 parts in it, but its still superb-even better, its FREE! i got two of these lovely things in the Sunday mirror which i both opened(im not the greedy collector type who likes to keep everything unopened) and now i cant help thinking that ive played with these more than my bigger sets, such as the venator and clone turbo tank.
Overall: grab a copy of the sunday mirror and build yourself a little boat before they're gone!

author: richselby
title: One for the Youngsters
review:
A minifigure, a large one-piece dinghy and that's about it. No subtle building techniques, not much you could reuse elsewhere.  But who's to complain when it came free with a daily newspaper? 

I gave this set to my four year old niece. It was her first ever Lego set. She managed to build it with almost no help and she loved playing with it afterwards. So vg for the v little ones, I'd say.

author: bryck123
title: Nice add on for a police marine unit
review:
Picked up a cpl of these cheap on ebay to use as support units for my marine unit set up. What you see is what you get!

Pros

  • Cheap (should be able to pick up for about the price of a collectable minifig aka free dinghy!
  • Quick build

Cons

  • The windshield set up uses up almost all the space for a passenger or cargo

Don't spend too much but this is a nice lil impulse item

author: Agent_L3r
title: It ok.....
review:
I got this set with my daily mirror and when i got home, i was shocked to see what was inside.
First, the mini-figure was the same guy, The Police uniform with the head with the silver shades.
Then, the building experience was horrible, i put this together in about 30 seconds, only a few parts. The playability is great! It floats on water and i recommend this as an add-on for the 7287 Police boat as i did.

Overall, its an "OK" set
